citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
Bryson, a black and brown male Yorkshire terrier with ID tag #80, DOB 07/01/2021, had a moderate accumulation of
brown material on the surface of the cheek teeth. The licensee stated his dogs are not on an oral preventative care and
that he schedules dental cleanings at the recommendation of his veterinarian. Bryson has not received professional
dental cleaning. A dental cleaning was suggested by his veterinarian on November 18, 2024.
It is important to ensure all animals have no signs of dental disease. The abnormal build-up of material on the teeth can
cause damage to the gum tissue and tooth structures. This condition could be painful, may decrease the dog's ability to
eat normally, and may result in spread of bacteria to other parts of the body such as liver and kidneys which can
negatively impact the overall health of the animal.
The licensee must communicate with the attending veterinarian to evaluate the dog and determine an appropriate plan for
diagnosis and treatment.
Correct by 01/06/26.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.40(b)(2) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
Bryson, a black and brown male Yorkshire terrier with ID tag #80, DOB 07/01/2021, had a moderate accumulation of 
brown material on the surface of the cheek teeth. The licensee stated his dogs are not on an oral preventative care and 
that he schedules dental cleanings at the recommendation of his veterinarian. Bryson has not received professional 
dental cleaning. A dental cleaning was suggested by his veterinarian on November 18, 2024. 
It is important to ensure all animals have no signs of dental disease. The abnormal build-up of material on the teeth can 
cause damage to the gum tissue and tooth structures. This condition could be painful, may decrease the dog's ability to 
eat normally, and may result in spread of bacteria to other parts of the body such as liver and kidneys which can 
negatively impact the overall health of the animal. 
The licensee must communicate with the attending veterinarian to evaluate the dog and determine an appropriate plan for 
diagnosis and treatment. 
Correct by 01/06/26. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
